items.x-path: /bgp-lsp/states/state/{vrf_name af destination_address prefix_length index type indirect_id frr_type}/

parameters.name: vrf_name af destination_address prefix_length index type indirect_id frr_type
parameters.description: ID of vrf_name af destination_address prefix_length index type indirect_id frr_type

items.x-path: /bgp-lsp/states/state/{vrf_name af destination_address prefix_length index type indirect_id frr_type}/tunnels/tunnel/{value}/

ttl-mode.description: Specifies the TTL mode, The available options are Uniform and Pipe. By default, the mode is Pipe.

bgp-lsp_schema.description: BGP LSP configuration and query items.

bfd.description: Configure dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

parameters.description: Configure parameters of BFD for BGP LSP.

enable.description: Enable/disable dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval at which BFD packets are sent.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval at which BFD packets are received.

trigger.description: Configure a policy for creating BGP LSP BFD sessions.

trigger-ip-prefix-name.description: To use an IP prefix list to dynamically create BFD sessions, specify a name of the IP prefix list.

sessions.description: List of the sessions of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

session.description: Statistics of a session of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

fec-address.description: Display the FEC address of the session of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

out-if-name.description: Display the outbound interface of a BGP LSP.

next-hop.description: Display the next hop of a BGP LSP.

index.description: Display the LSP index of a BGP LSP.

discriminator.description: Display the BFD discriminator of the BFD session of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

state.description: Display the BFD session state of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

min-tx-interval.description: Display the minimum interval at which BFD packets of the session of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP are sent.

min-rx-interval.description: Display the minimum interval at which BFD packets of the session of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP are received.

detection-multiplier.description: Display the BFD detection multiplier of the BFD session of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

age.description: Display the BFD session age of dynamic BFD for BGP LSP.

vrf-name.description: VPN name of a BGP instance.

af.description: Specifies the address family type of a BGP instance.

prefix-length.description: Prefix length of the destination address of an LSP.

qos-priority-mode.description: QoS priority mode of an LSP.

route-distinguisher.description:
A VPN address family takes effect only after it is configured with an RD. The format of an RD is as follows:
1. 16-bit AS number:32-bit user-defined number, for example, 101:3. An AS number ranges from 0 to 65535, and a user-defined number ranges from 0 to 4294967295. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the RD value cannot be 0:0.
2. 32-bit IP address:16-bit user-defined number, for example: 192.168.122.15:1. The IP address ranges from 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255, and the user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535.
3. 32-bit AS number:16-bit user-defined number, for example, 10.11:3. An AS number ranges from 0.0 to 65535.65535 or from 0 to 4294967295, and a user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the RD value cannot be 0.0:0.

state.x-key: vrf-name af destination-address prefix-length index type indirect-id frr-type

route-distinguisher.description:
A VPN address family takes effect only after it is configured with an RD. The format of an RD is as follows:
1. 16-bit AS number:32-bit user-defined number, for example, 101:3. An AS number ranges from 0 to 65535, and a user-defined number ranges from 0 to 4294967295. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the RD value cannot be 0:0.
2. 32-bit IP address:16-bit user-defined number, for example: 192.168.122.15:1. The IP address ranges from 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255, and the user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535.
3. 32-bit AS number:16-bit user-defined number, for example, 10.11:3. An AS number ranges from 0.0 to 65535.65535 or from 0 to 4294967295, and a user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the RD value cannot be 0.0:0.
